alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 12:22AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Osceola County through 100 AM EDT... At 1222 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Intercession City to near Haines City to near Lake Wales. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kissimmee, Saint Cloud, Intercession City, East Lake Toho and Narcoossee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
